name: OrganizationType
title: Organization Type
description: Types of organizations participating in the placement and servicing of coverage.

concept.definition: A company that underwrites and issues policies, assuming the financial obligation for covered losses.
An intermediary who represents the buyer in placing coverage with one or more carriers.
An agent with delegated authority to underwrite, bind, and administer policies on behalf of a carrier.
A firm that handles claims processing, policy administration, or other back-office functions on behalf of another organization.
A company that provides coverage to other carriers, sharing or assuming portions of their obligations.
A broker licensed to place coverage with non-admitted carriers for exposures not available in the standard market.
An intermediary that distributes products from carriers to retail brokers rather than directly to the public.
An organization that designs and manages specialty programs, typically with delegated underwriting authority for a specific class of business.
A firm that manages the investigation, adjustment, and settlement of claims on behalf of a carrier or self-insured entity.
A lender that finances the payment of premiums, allowing the buyer to pay in installments.
An organization that develops classification systems, rating algorithms, and standardized forms used across the industry.
A member-owned entity formed to provide liability coverage to its members, typically within the same industry.
A wholly owned subsidiary created to provide coverage to its parent company or related group.
A company that provides independent loss adjustment and investigation services.
